segments.text: The woman is so focused on drying that plate, it's almost funny how oblivious she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and she's completely unaware of the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, trying to get those cookies without her knowing, it's almost impressive.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool is so wobbly, it's making me anxious just looking at it, I hope he doesn't fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share of the cookies, so patient and hopeful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really turn around and see what's happening behind her, she needs to be more aware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside, it's a stark contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn't fall and make a bigger mess than there already is, that would be a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading all over the floor, it's getting worse by the second, someone needs to clean it up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the water or the children's antics, she seems so distracted by her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really pushing his limits with that stool, he's quite the risk-taker.
segments.speaker: PAR
